description.narrative: For Ecoceanos' work to oppose the expansion of Chile's farmed fish industry. The recent discovery of Infectious Salmon Anemia (ISA) in the Magallanes and subantarctic regions of Chile has sparked intensified local opposition to Chile's farmed salmon and trout industry, which looks to expand heavily into the far southern Aysen and Magellan/Patagonia region. Ecoceanos will work with member groups of the Patagonia Without Salmon Farms Social Coordinating Committee to mobilize members of the Magellan community against the farms. These efforts will include a communications and public awareness campaign; a signature campaign to support a moratorium on new concessions that threaten the estuaries, fjords, and lakes of the Magellan region; assessment process aimed at articulating the biological, environmental, and legal arguments to support moratoria on farm expansion; transparency and citizen oversight efforts; and a national campaign to ban salmon farms and associated facilities in vulnerable coastal regions
